text: hi my name's Simon Jack I'm the business
editor of the BBC today we're talking
about the value of the pound in the last
week it's fallen quite sharply against
the dollar and the euro so why is that
happening well a few polls have pointed
to the fact that the vote leave campaign
is gaining a bit of ground which makes
Briggs it more likely now Briggs it is
more likely there would be a period of
uncertainty if we were to leave and that
has got people worried about the value
of sterling generally the currency is
like share price of a country if it's
confident and certainly goes up if
there's uncertainty the value of the
currency can go down so as it becomes
more likely or Briggs it becomes more
likely sterling has begun to fall now
why does that matter well it means that
if we were to leave European Union and
sterling fell our exports would be
cheaper to customers overseas that's a
good thing however imports that came the
other way would get more expensive and
as a country we import more than we
export so some people fear that prices
could rise now how much uncertainty
would have is up for debate a lot of
people think there'll be a short-term
burst of uncertainty and then things
would calm down but keep your eye on the
pound that's the canary in the coal mine
the more likely Briggs it looks in the
polls as we come up to the referendum on
june the 23rd the more likely sterling
will be default just a little bit as i
say it could be short-lived but expect
sterling to bounce around a lot over the
next days weeks
